intro: Gossypium californicum, commonly known as the California cottonplant, is a species native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its cotton-like seeds are encased in a fluffy, white covering, which is a characteristic feature of the genus Gossypium. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to survive in dry conditions.
